result.execSummary:
The defendant Freddy Rodas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Freddy Rodas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Freddy Rodas was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge; and all applicable fees of supervision. to be paid by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution set at zero.

- No possession of weapons.Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with Probation Department.
- Write a letter of apology to the victim within 30 days.
- No Contact with the victim.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment/education/vocation.
- Court orders no other speific programming conditions. Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Huber for work; Court STAYED commencement until 09-14-15
*10/12/2015  release granted for scheduled visits with physician, subject to HOC verification.

Bail Refund Check Packet
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, received and filed

Defendant Freddy Rodas in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1 YEAR at the House of Corrections straight time with 33 days credit if revoked.  The sentence is CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 60 days condition time with Huber for work. Court stayed commencement until 9/14/2015
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with Probation Department
- No possession of weapons
- Write a letter of apology to the victim within 30 days
- No contact with the victim
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount is set at zero
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied, balance of cash bail to be returned to the person who posted

Filed:  Sentencing Referral Form

Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed with
   - Pretrial Incarceration Credit form
Defense motion to allow defendant to begin a new job granted.  Defense motion to remove GPS monitoring heard and granted.

As to Count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Voluntary plea form and elements received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
As to Count 1:    Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19 on 8/31/15 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Freddy Rodas in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 2 added.  The charge added is Theft - Movable Property (Special Facts)  , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943/20(1)(a) and (3) (d), 939.50(3)(h) , a Class H felony.

Defendant Freddy Rodas in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Freddy Rodas in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Oscar Piceno-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
